page.title: 13WOODMINTON ATTITUDES
page.content: WIDOW of 78 years - "We are a very happy community. I have got used to the many changes and the isolation does not worry me. The aches in my shoulders are from the days when I had to fetch water from a field well when our own well was dry. In 1950, electricity came and mains water in 1955". A London University Administrator now widowed and retired - "Life is harmonious & serene. Our peace is only punctuated by the harsh intrusions of modern living - the helicopter overhead and heavy road traffic passing from a local farm business taking a short cut to Wilton" Husband, wife & 2 children - "We like living in this village because of the freedom of movement in the beautiful countryside. We love the clean air and being able to pursue our hobby - running - without restriction".
